National Suicide Prevention Lifeline '1-800-273-TALK (8255)' is with Renée Angelie and Twnmidine Twanmidine.
September 8 at 3:26 PM ·

While being physically present may not be an option right now due to COVID-19, there are still many other ways to #BeThere for someone else. In honor of Suicide Prevention Month, we'll be releasing a series of graphics that will list the 5 action steps you can take to help someone else while still physically distancing.

If you think someone might be considering suicide, don't be afraid to take the first step and #BeThe1To ask. Ask them directly, "Are you thinking about suicide?" This communicates that you’re open to speaking about suicide in a non-judgmental and supportive way.

We said we'd circle back around, and today is the day!

Just before Virginia school buildings closed for the remainder of the academic year due to COVID-19, the Norview High School boys basketball team was crowned as the Virginia High School League 5A Boys Co-State Champions.

VHSL canceled the remaining state finals that March weekend because of the expanding health threats. Since the championship game could not be played, VHSL determined both Norview High School and Green Run High School (Virginia Beach) would share the honor.

So, today, as we have somewhat settled in to this new normal, we take the time to say CONGRATULATIONS to our Norview HS Pilots and thank you for bringing home another state title to NPS!

This is the third year in a row a Norfolk high school has won a state championship. Previous winners were the Maury Commodores in 2019 (5A) and the Lake Taylor Titans in 2018 (4A).

#WayToGoNHSPilots #NPSProud

The 4th and 5th grade girls of #OceanairElementarySchool welcomed Miss America Organization 2020 Camille Schrier with open arms on Thursday.

Miss America did a very fine job of making sure the students walked away with an important key to life: it is okay to be different, but stay authentic to yourself.

Schrier explained her journey in first becoming Miss Virginia and why she chose to conduct a science experiment during the talent portion of the competition. She shared that being different set her above the rest, and ultimately led to her being crowned Miss America in less than a year’s time.

“Don’t let anyone change you!” were a few of Schrier’s parting words for the young girls.

Schrier spent about 20 minutes answering questions that ranged from “What is your favorite color?” to “How does your crown stay on and do you get to keep it?”

The 24-year-old Biochemist hugged each student as they left the room.

post_text: Today the partners who helped make the construction of Camp Allen Elementary School a reality gathered to celebrate with a dedication ceremony. Camp Allen is unique because almost $23 million of its $28.7 million cost came from a Department of Defense Grant. The City of Norfolk paid the balance of that cost! Principal Deena Copeland presided over a program that included remarks from Mayor Kenneth Alexander, Capt. Jonathan Kline, School Board Chair Dr. Noelle Gabriel, Acting Superintendent Sharon Byrdsong, and Justin Ballard of S.B.Ballard Construction Company. Highlights of the day were student introductions of the speakers, musical performances from Camp Allen Dragons and the unveiling of the school's beautiful "Dragon Family" mosaic mural.

Jay Lang started the Lang Foundation in honor of his father, and has granted quite a few Norfolk Public Schools’ students with their own instruments over the past few years.
